a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Gender parity in gross enrolment rates from primary through tertiary education,
Ratio of female to male gross school enrolment rates, which is defined as the number of people of any age who are enrolled
in a given level of education expressed as a percentage of the total population of the corresponding official school age.
Gender parity is defined as a GPI between 0.97 and 1.03. Values below 0.97 favour males, and above 1 favour females.

text.textPath: Target: Gender parity defined as GPI between 0.97 and 1.03
Target: Gender parity defined as GPI between 0.97 and 1.03

text.tspan: Data source: World Bank, Gender Statistics (based on multiple sources)
Note: In ratios, 0.5 and 1.5 seem equidistant from 1, but they show different disparities. A GPI of 0.5 suggests female enrolment is half
of males, while 1.5 indicates 50% more enrolment, not double.
